page.title: 01LANDSCAPE REVIEW LUTON WEST
page.content: In large part this is the plateau of the Chilterns, a high but relatively flat area, a part of the scarp is also included. The Roman Watling St A5 and the M1 use dry valleys to pass through the area. The steep scarp is little used, being an open space near the towns. The plateau is mainly farmland, wheat, barley,rape and grass; there are no large numbers of sheep or cattle, the numbers of horses are noticeable. The NE fringe is part of Luton, on the plateau is the 1950's council estate of Farley Hill, below the scarp houses of early 1900's, 1930's and 1970's., together with a continuous industrial zone. Other settlements include the village of Caddington, hamlet of Chaul End and several isolated farms. Transport and services relate to Luton and Dunstable.
